author: potuz
content:
It's a little involved, say you run with 70% LH and 30% Lodestar, you want to avoid publishing the payload but still have it in the LH nodes, so the LH nodes will attest to their blocks and build on full, we want to check that LH 
1) Lodestar requests payloads by RPC
2) LH serves those payloads. 
3) Lodestars tries to reorg some of these payloads cause it hasn't gotten them on time to process
4) LH reorgs back the block that reorged the payload.

author: potuz
content: I'm not worried about the latest two, but I do want to check that clients can continue syncing blocks and don't entirely split up if there is a single missing payload
